alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Van Buren; Warren; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 5:57PM CDT until July 28 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Cumberland County in Middle Tennessee... Van Buren County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Warren County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern White County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 556 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sparta to 9 miles southwest of Spencer, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Spencer, Pleasant Hill, Virgin Falls State Natural Area and Fall Creek Falls State Park. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 311 and 315. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
